thread.title: Don't kid yourself: if the Nazis had occupied Britain, they would have found many willing collaborators
thread.title_full: Don't kid yourself: if the Nazis had occupied Britain, they would have found many willing collaborators

author: Nigel Jones
title: Don't kid yourself: if the Nazis had occupied Britain, they would have found many willing collaborators
text:
A large Swastika flag flaps over Buckingham Palace. The crash of jackboots echoes along Downing Street as grim, black-uniformed SS troopers march down Whitehall. A car screeches to a halt in a suburban avenue as Gestapo secret policemen in leather coats ring the doorbell of a semi-detached home housing a British resistance cell.
These and similar images will become familiar over the next few weeks as the BBC continues its lavish TV adaptation of "SS-GB" , Len Deighton's chilling fictional portrayal of a Britain under brutal Nazi occupation.
But do we really need a to watch a Sunday night drama series or read Deighton's brilliant novel to tell us what might have happened had the the Second World war had a different outcome? The truth is that we already know.
SS-GB imagines a world in which Britain collaborates with the Nazis Credit: BBC/Sid Gentle Films W e know because the Nazis themselves, with typical German thoroughness, had made meticulous plans for how they would rule a conquered Britain...
